structural_unit_name.en: Department of Sports Medicine and Rehabilitation

description.en:
The course includes lectures (acute sports injuries, overuse syndromes, tendinopathies, rehabiliatation of sports injuries) and seminars (case analysis, rehabilitation of sports injuries).
All recorded e-lectures can be viewed in the Moodle environment any time.  One work seminar is conducted in web (BBB) and one practical session will be performed as contact lesson.

In order to pass the course:
-  participation in seminar and practical session
-  multiple choice test (Final test in Moodle) according to e-lectures' materials
description.et:
Kursus sisaldab salvestatud e-loenguid (ägedad spordivigastsued, ülekoormussündroomid, tendinopaatiad, spordivigastuste taastusravi jne), ning seminare (haigusjuhtude arutelu, spordivigastuste taastusravi).
Arvestuse saamiseks on vajalik e- loengute kuulamine. Seminarides osalemine on kohustuslik ning  kursuse lõppedes tuleb teha kirjalik test postiivsele hindele (Moodles)
Võlgnevused saab likvideerida kokkuleppel vastutava õppejõuga.

objectives.en: The aim of the course to give principal knowledges in sports traumatology and main principles of injury prevention and treatment
objectives.et: Omandada põhiteadmised sportlastel sagedamini esinevatest ägedatest- ja ülekoormusvigastusest ning vastavatest ennetus- ja ravivõimalustest

learning_outcomes.en: 1) is able to give an adequate first aid in case of acute injuries of the athlete
2) is able to evaluate the most common acute injuries of the athlete
learning_outcomes.et: 2) oskab hinnata sagedamini esinevaid ägedaid spordivigastusi

learning_outcomes.en: 3) is able to evaluate the most common musculoskeletal overuse syndromes in athletes
learning_outcomes.et: 3) oskab hinnata sagedamini esinevaid skeleti-lihassüsteemi ülekoormussündroome

learning_outcomes.en: 4) is well-acquianted with rehabilitation of sports injuries
learning_outcomes.et: 4) omandatakse põhiteadmised taastusravi võimalustest spordivigastuste korral

notes.et:
The elective course is passed if
a) you have acquired the materials covered in lectures and seminars
b) ) you have participated in webinars
c) you have passed the control test.
The test consists of multiple-choice questions and 80% must be answered correctly. The test can be performed an unlimited number of times.

All the e-lectures in Moodle cover your independent work at home (altogether 37 academic hours), there is no need to prepare other materials, except materials for seminar)

description.et: analysis and discussion of the cases

grade_preconditions.et: Participation in e-lectures, BBB seminars or contact learning

grade_evaluation.et: Participation in e-lectures, BBB seminars or contact learning

resources.recommended_materials: Peterson L, Renström P. Sports Injuries. Their prevention and treatment. 3rd Edition. Human Kinetcs, Champaign, IL, 2001
